intro: Adnaria brachycera, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed adnaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The leaves are alternate, finely divided, and often covered in a soft, hairy texture. Native to certain regions of southern Europe and the Mediterranean, it thrives in well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
